a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child mortality rate in boys vs. girls, 2020
Child mortality rate is measured as the probability per 1,000 that a newborn baby will die before reaching
age five, if subject to age-specific mortality rates of the specified year.
Also shown is the parity line, along which mortality rates in boys and girls are equal.
Child mortality rate of girls (per 1,000 births)
Child mortality rate of boys (per 1,000 live births)
Data source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (via World Bank)
